title: Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score with ESR (ASDAS-ESR)
description: Stratifies severity of ankylosing spondylitis (AS) using clinical and laboratory data, specifically ESR. The ASDAS-ESR is a composite index to assess disease activity in axial spondyloarthritis, combining patient-reported outcomes with laboratory measures to provide a comprehensive evaluation of disease activity.

parameters.name: back_pain
parameters.description: Overall level of AS neck, back, or hip pain (0-10 scale)

parameters.name: morning_stiffness
parameters.description: Overall level of morning stiffness from the time you wake up (0-10 scale)

parameters.name: patient_global
parameters.description: How active was your spondylitis, on average, during the last week (0-10 scale)

parameters.name: peripheral_pain
parameters.description: Overall level of pain/swelling in joints other than neck, back, or hips (0-10 scale)

result.name: asdas_esr_score
result.description: ASDAS-ESR score calculated from clinical and laboratory parameters

ranges.interpretation: Disease activity is inactive. Patient has minimal symptoms and inflammation markers are low. Continue current management and monitor regularly.
Disease activity is moderate. Consider optimization of current therapy or initiation of biological therapy if not already on treatment. Monitor closely for response.
Disease activity is high. Strongly consider biological therapy if not already initiated. Increase monitoring frequency and assess treatment response regularly.

Disease activity is very high. Urgent consideration for biological therapy or switching to alternative biological agent if already on treatment. Close monitoring and rapid treatment optimization required.

references: Lukas C, Landewé R, Sieper J, Dougados M, Davis J, Braun J, van der Linden S, van der Heijde D. Development of an ASAS-endorsed disease activity score (ASDAS) in patients with ankylosing spondylitis. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009 Jan;68(1):18-24. doi: 10.1136/ard.2008.094870.

van der Heijde D, Lie E, Kvien TK, Sieper J, van den Bosch F, Listing J, Braun J, Landewé R. ASDAS, a highly discriminatory ASAS-endorsed disease activity score in patients with ankylosing spondylitis. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009 Dec;68(12):1811-8. doi: 10.1136/ard.2008.100826.

Machado P, Landewé R, Lie E, Kvien TK, Braun J, Baker D, van der Heijde D. Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Score (ASDAS): defining cut-off values for disease activity states and improvement scores. Ann Rheum Dis. 2011 Jan;70(1):47-53. doi: 10.1136/ard.2010.138594.
formula: ASDAS-ESR = 0.08 × Back Pain + 0.07 × Duration of Morning Stiffness + 0.11 × Patient Global + 0.09 × Peripheral Pain/Swelling + 0.29 × √(ESR)
notes: All patient-reported parameters (back pain, morning stiffness, patient global, peripheral pain) are assessed on a 0-10 numerical rating scale or visual analogue scale.
ESR should be measured in mm/hr using standard laboratory methods.
The ASDAS-CRP version (using C-reactive protein) is preferred over ASDAS-ESR when CRP is available.
Cut-offs for improvement: ≥1.1 units indicates clinically important improvement, ≥2.0 units indicates major improvement.
This score is validated for axial spondyloarthritis (including ankylosing spondylitis) patients.
